column5: Had the great pleasure to take 5 returning guests out from 2019 at Onaway Lodge.Fishing was pretty good but bit different.In the 2 days we were out we did not have the big schools of walleyes.We found them more scattered over larger areas in the 22-24+ depths which have up lots of fish.Jigging was good but a verticle lindy rig did much better.Tried some shallow areas and weed beds but those didn't work out well.Water Temps around 65-67 F.Caught some pike also in the same depth as walleyes.Got some bass in the 13-15 ft range.Weather was great and wind was pretty good but day one fairly strong and hard to control the tiller camp boats.Most fish that were caught were in the slot and some over.
Nice fish n nice blue skies!
Days turned out nice Eck.Exception was early morning at 0c.Right up your alley.Had ice on my windshield Sunday morning.lol.
Time for the fish to put on the feed bag I would say!!
They were all fat.Saw fish way deeper but will just leave those alone.No use killing fish for no reason.Next week we will catch them in 3 ft-8 ft.on a gullet.Maybe of the dock.
